poetry.title: The Road Goes Ever On
poetry.content: The Road goes ever on and on, down from the door where it began...

poetry.title: Song of Durin
poetry.content: The world was young, the mountains green, no stain yet on the Moon was seen...

poetry.title: Lament for Gandalf
poetry.content: I will not say: do not weep; for not all tears are an evil.

letters.title: Letter 131: Reflection on War
letters.content: I feel that it is time for me to give an account of my adventures, not as a tale of wonder, but as a humble chronicle of my own experiences.

letters.title: Letter 210: On Hope
letters.content: In these dark days, even the smallest light shines brightly in the heart of those who believe.

letters.title: Letter 196: Thoughts on the West
letters.content: It is a strange thing that men cannot be forever loyal to the cause of hope, for their hearts are ever prone to wander.
